value.title: Introduction to Power BI
value.excerpt: Introduction to Power BI

value.title: Dynamic Power BI reports using Parameters
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how you can use a parameter, within a Power BI report, to dynamically change the data in a report. This uses M Functions within Power Query and a second source that has the key values to pull. Then using a gateway to enable refresh.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: Creating a simple date table in Power BI
value.excerpt: This video shows how to build a basic date table using a calculated table and DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/137725
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-li7sxUxEqA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI date table: create using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to create a Power BI date table using DAX. The end result uses a combination of the GENERATE(), ROW() and CALENDARAUTO() DAX functions to create a calculated table resulting in a Power BI date table.  Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-generate-and-row-instead-of-addcolumns-in-dax/

value.title: Introducing CALCULATE in DAX
value.excerpt: This video introduces CALCULATE, the most powerful and complex function in DAX.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/749147?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Showing actuals and forecasts in the same chart with Power BI
value.excerpt: In budgeting reports, a common requirement is to show future sales forecast and actual sales volume on the same line chart. Learn how to achieve this goal using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/73386?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.

value.title: Month over Month Calculation in Power BI using DAX
value.excerpt: When working with dates, one of the common types of analysis is period vs period, such as Year over year, and Month over month. In this article and video, I'll explain how you can use DAX to write calculations for month-over-month simply in any Power BI report. download the Power BI file and find the

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that youâ€™re seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI

You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that youâ€™re seeking for deeper analytics.
